title: 🚀 Built a Reddit-style Blazor Forum with Full Login & Authorization from Scratch
body:
I just finished Assignment 6 (Authentication & Authorization) for my .NET Blazor course — and I’m proud of how it turned out!

🔑 Users can sign up, log in, and log out, with all sessions persisted in the browser using sessionStorage.
👤 The Account dropdown dynamically switches between “Sign in / Sign up” and “Log out” + username.
💬 Once logged in, users can create, edit, and delete only their own posts and comments, while viewing everyone else’s.

On the backend, I added an AuthController for POST /auth/login and simple DTOs (LoginRequest, UserDto).
On the frontend, Blazor uses a custom SimpleAuthProvider implementing AuthenticationStateProvider, wiring it all up with claims and state refreshes.

🔧 Tech stack:

ASP.NET Core Web API (.NET 10)

Blazor Server (.NET 10)

Custom AuthenticationStateProvider

Bootstrap 5 UI

Here’s what I learned:

How to use claims-based authentication in Blazor

Cascading authentication state with <CascadingAuthenticationState>

Using AuthorizeView and [Authorize] to protect UI and pages

How to cache login state in sessionStorage

It feels amazing to finally have a working login system integrated into a full-stack Blazor + Web API app

title: What is JWT (JSON Web Token)?
body:
🔐 What is JWT (JSON Web Token)?

JWT = JSON Web Token, a compact, secure way to represent a user’s identity and claims between the client (like your Blazor app) and the server (your Web API).

Think of it as a digital ID card that the server issues when a user logs in.

Here’s the idea:

User logs in → sends username + password to the server (/auth/login).

The server verifies credentials.

The server creates a token (JWT) that contains info like:

{
  "sub": "Bartek",
  "id": 12,
  "role": "user",
  "exp": 1731450000
}

title: ⚠️ Why Idon’t need JWT for this assignment 06?
body:
For Assignment 6, your login system is local and educational, running Blazor and Web API on the same machine.
The goal is to understand how authentication and authorization work, not to implement production-level security.

JWT is meant for:

Public web applications

APIs that multiple clients consume

Scenarios where the server and client are on different domains

Enterprise or production apps where you need token-based, stateless login

title: Design & Alignment Guide for the Designer
body:
Color Scheme:

Use royal metallic gold (#D4AF37 or #FFD700) for text when placed on black background areas (like the footer or logo strip).

Use rich black text (#111111) when placed on white or light gray background (like top part of the poster).

📐 Alignment & Layout:

Center align all text vertically and horizontally for a premium, balanced look.

Place “Naaz LPG” slightly larger and bolder in the center or lower middle — it’s the hero brand.

Keep “Black Friday – Big Discount” at the top with a bit of sparkle/glow effect in gold.

“Free Delivery” and “Order Now & Save Big” go below it with equal spacing.

“Premium Quality • Certified Agency” should be the smallest line, at the bottom (footer area).

🖼️ Visual Style Notes:

Maintain the gray or white background with the black-and-gold gas cylinder in the center.

Add gold balloons and light sparkles to highlight the festive Black Friday theme.

Use modern sans-serif font (like Montserrat, Poppins, or Bebas Neue) for a bold and trustworthy look.
